com.badlogic.gdx.backends.jogl
Class JoglApplication

java.lang.Object
  com.badlogic.gdx.backends.jogl.JoglApplication
All Implemented Interfaces:
Application, RenderListener
public final class JoglApplication
extends java.lang.Object
implements Application, RenderListener

An implementation of Application for desktop Java. Creates a new JFrame and puts a Jogl Canvas into it. To instantiate it do the following: public static void main( String[] argv ) { JoglApplication app = new JoglApplication( "My title", 480, 320 ); app.addRenderListener( new MyRenderer() ); } This creates a new JoglApplication and registers a RenderListener implementation called "MyRenderer" with it.

Author:
mzechner

Method Detail

addRenderListener

public void addRenderListener(RenderListener listener)
Adds a RenderListener to this application. The listener's setup method is called once before the render method is invoked. The render method is called as long as the listener is registered with the application. Upon application shutdown the dispose method is called.

Specified by:
addRenderListener in interface Application
Parameters:
listener - The listener to add.

clear

public void clear(boolean color,
                  boolean depth,
                  boolean stencil)
Clears the buffers for which the flag is set to true. Uses the current clear color set by Application.clearColor() and the OpenGL default values for the depth buffer and stencil buffer. FIXME should also be able to specify depth and stencil clear value

Specified by:
clear in interface Application
Parameters:
color - clear the color (frame) buffer
depth - clear the depth buffer
stencil - clear the stencil buffer (not supported yet)

disable

public void disable(Application.RenderState state)
Disables the given Application.RenderState.
  • RenderState.DepthTest will also call glDepthMask( false )

Specified by:
disable in interface Application
Parameters:
state - The render state

enable

public void enable(Application.RenderState state)
Enables the given Application.RenderState. This is equivalent to glEnable. A couple of convenience settings are performed for a vew RenderStates:
  • RenderState.Lighting will also enable GL_COLOR_MATERIAL
  • RenderState.DepthTest will also call glDepthMask( true )
  • RenderState.AlphaTest will also call gl.glAlphaFunc( GL.GL_GREATER, 0.9f )

Specified by:
enable in interface Application
Parameters:
state - The render state to enable

setAmbientLight

public void setAmbientLight(float r,
                            float g,
                            float b,
                            float a)
Sets the ambient light color. This is equal to calling gl.glLightModelfv( GL.GL_LIGHT_MODEL_AMBIENT, color, 0 ).

setDirectionalLight

public void setDirectionalLight(int light,
                                float x,
                                float y,
                                float z,
                                float r,
                                float g,
                                float b,
                                float a)
Sets the light to the given direction and color. It has to be enabled via enableLight. The direction has to be normalized. Sets the ambient and diffuse color of the directional light to the given color components. As oposed to the standard notion of OpenGL the light direction is really given as a direction and not as a negative direction as usual!

Specified by:
setDirectionalLight in interface Application
Parameters:
light - The number of the light source
x - The direction x component
y - The direction y component
z - The direction z component
r - The red component
g - The green component
b - The blue component
a - The alpha component

getTextInput

public void getTextInput(Application.TextInputListener listener,
                         java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String text)
System dependent method to input a string of text. A dialog box will be created with the given title and the given text as a message for the user. Once the dialog has been closed the provided Application.TextInputListener will be called in the rendering thread.

Specified by:
getTextInput in interface Application
Parameters:

newTexture

public Texture newTexture(Pixmap pixmap,
                          Application.TextureFilter minFilter,
                          Application.TextureFilter maxFilter,
                          Application.TextureWrap uWrap,
                          Application.TextureWrap vwrap)
Creates a texture from the specified Pixmap. Tries to create a texture with the format of the pixmap. The parameters specify the textures minification and magnification filters as well as the texture wrap mode in u and v. Only power of two textures are supported. Behaviour for none power of two textures is not specified.

Specified by:
newTexture in interface Application
Parameters:
pixmap - The pixmap.
minFilter - The minification filter.
maxFilter - The magnification filter.
uWrap - The wrap in u.
vwrap - The wrap in v.
Returns:
The texture.

newPixmap

public Pixmap newPixmap(java.lang.String file,
                        Pixmap.Format format)
Creates a new Pixmap from the given resource. The file is given relative to the assets root directory on Android and relative to the application directory on the PC.

Specified by:
newPixmap in interface Application
Parameters:
file - The file.
Returns:
The Pixmap.

newPixmap

public Pixmap newPixmap(java.lang.Object nativeImage)
Creates a new Pixmap from a native image. On Android this is an instance of Bitmap, on the PC this is an instance of BufferedImage.
